EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Student ID: {!Contact.Person_ID__c}
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
It is with regret that I inform you that you have been discontinued in good standing as at XXX due to your expired enrolment, in accordance with Section 8 of the Graduate Research Progress Management Procedures.
For your information should you wish to apply to be re-admitted please refer to the Graduate Research Re-admission procedures for details.
A student who has been discontinued in good standing is no longer a student of the University, but may apply to be re-admitted into the research degree in which they were previously enrolled at Monash, as long as the application is submitted within 4 years of the date of discontinue in good standing, in accordance with regulation 42 of the Monash University (Academic Board) Regulations.
Please note that your application to be re-admitted must be submitted within 4 years of the date of ‘discontinued in good standing’ and that the Graduate Research Committee will only approve re-admission where suitable facilities and effective supervision are available to support the research project, and where the Committee is satisfied that the student is now in a position to pursue the research project to its completion.
If you are an international student studying in Australia on a student visa, you are strongly encouraged to contact Monash Connect for advice on this matter by phone on +61 3 9902 011 or www.monash.edu/connect.
The Monash Postgraduate Association on your campus can provide you with advice and assistance. For contact details of the MPA on your campus, please refer to http://mpa.monash.edu.au/
I would also encourage you to consider seeking additional support from the following services:
• Beyondblue: 1300 22 46 36
• Lifeline: 1311 14
• EAP: 1800 350 359 (After hours)
• Your local GP/Health Service Provider
• University Health Services 99053020 (Office hours)
On behalf of the Academic Director (Graduate Research), we would like to take this opportunity to wish you all the very best in your future endeavours.
Sincerely,
Monash Graduate Education
